noun.description: The maximum extent of a vibration or oscillation, measured from the position of equilibrium.
The angular distance of a celestial object from the true east or west point of the horizon at rising or setting.

examples: the amplitude of the crime of manslaughter lies beneath murder

noun.description: The angle between the real axis of an Argand diagram and a vector representing a complex number.

origin: Mid 16th century (in the senses physical extent and grandeur): from Latin amplitudo, from amplus large, abundant.
